= state in which a countable entity is seven in number

Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= woman; ◄ of Beersheba (בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע) ► wife of Ahaziah (אֲחַזְיָה) mother of Joash (יְהֹואָשׁ) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= man; ◄ son of Ahaziah (אֲחַזְיָהוּ) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (835 796)
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
= man; ◄ tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► priest (כֹּהֵן) time of queen Athaliah (עֲתַלְיָה) and king Joash (יֹואָשׁ) of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so

= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= causative action by which humans or deities set apart humans or objects for a particular purpose or activity relating to the service of God, as a result of which they become holy (קָדֹושׁ)
= man; ◄ son of Asa (אָסָא) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (870/69 848)
= man; ◄ son of Jehoshaphat (יְהֹושָׁפָט) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (848 841)
= man, also known as Jehoahaz (יְהֹואָחָז) ◄ son of Joram (יְהֹורָם) ► king of southern kingdom of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= indirect male progenitor
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= man; ► king of Syria (אֲרָם) who annointed by the prophet (נָבִיא) Elijah (אֵלִיָּהוּ) and who murdered his predecessor Ben Hadad (בֶּן־הֲדַד)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= events that have taken place, that are not among a range of events that have been described or dealt with in a certain way; used for acts of kings only
= man; ◄ son of Ahaziah (אֲחַזְיָהוּ) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (835 796)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

Node.gloss: The Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah
Node.definition: = a book containing the events of the reigns of the kings of Judah
literally: words of days; hence: = a written record of events
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= action by which humans devise a plan concerning other humans ► with the intention to harm that person
= action by which humans devise a plan concerning other humans ► with the intention to harm that person

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Ahaziah (אֲחַזְיָהוּ) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (835 796)

m.definition: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

Node.definition: literally: (a boundary or measuring line) goes down; hence: = state in which a boundary or measuring line follows a certain trajectory downhill
= village; ◄ near Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= man, also known as Zabad (זָבָד) ► son of Shimeath (שִׁמְעָת) an Ammonite (עַמֹּונִי) woman; ► he was a servant of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) who murdered his master with the help of Jehozabad (יְהֹוזָבָד) son of Shimrith (שִׁמְרִית) both were later killed by Joash (יֹואָשׁ) successor Amaziah (אֲמַצְיָהוּ)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= woman; ◄ from Ammon (עַמֹּון) ► mother of Jozabad (יֹוזָבָד) (or: Zabad (זָבָד) servant of Joash (יְהֹואָשׁ) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

= man; ◄ son of Shomer (שֹׁמֵר) a Moabite (מֹואָבִי) woman; ► he was a servant of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) who murdered his master with the help of Jozabad (יֹוזָבָד) son of Shimeath (שִׁמְעָת) both were later killed by Joash (יֹואָשׁ) successor Amaziah (אֲמַצְיָהוּ)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ father of Jehozabad (יְהֹוזָבָד) official, time of Joash (יֹואָשׁ)

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= indirect male progenitor
= area within a town, in most cases protected by its own wall
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= man; ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
